questions.text: Which of the following is equal to $A \setminus B$?
questions.explanation: By definition, $A \setminus B$ consists of elements in $A$ that are not in $B$.

questions.text: Let $f : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be defined by $f(x)=x^2$. Which statement is true?
questions.explanation: Since $f(1)=f(-1)$, $f$ is not injective, and negative numbers are not in the image.

questions.text: Which of the following sets is a subset of $\{1,2,3\}$?
Which of the following is the union of the sets $A$ and $B$?
questions.explanation: The union $A \cup B$ contains all elements that are in $A$ or in $B$.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a function $f : A \to B$?
choices: Each element of $B$ is mapped to exactly one element of $A$
Each element of $A$ is mapped to at least one element of $B$
Each element of $A$ is mapped to exactly one element of $B$
Each element of $B$ is mapped to at most one element of $A$
questions.explanation: By definition, a function assigns to each element of the domain exactly one element of the codomain.

questions.text: Which of the following functions is injective?
questions.explanation: The function $f(x)=x^3$ is strictly increasing on $\mathbb{R}$ and therefore injective.

questions.text: Let $A=\{1,2,3\}$. How many elements does $\mathcal{P}(A)$ have?
questions.explanation: A set with $n$ elements has $2^n$ subsets; here $2^3=8$.
